headline: He's got Trump's endorsement, so why is David Perdue struggling as he primary challenges Georgia Gov. Kemp?
sentences:
ENCOURAGED BY TRUMP, PERDUE LAUNCHES PRIMARY CHALLENGE AGAINST KEMP
"There's one thing that's been pretty consistent and that's Brian Kemp's favorability and name ID remain remarkably strong throughout the attacks by Donald Trump," a veteran Georgia based GOP consultant  who asked for anonymity to speak more freely  told Fox News.

HE'S IN - AFTER ENCOURAGEMENT FROM TRUMP, HERSCHEL WALKER LAUNCHES SENATE RUN
In Georgia's GOP Senate primary, the Fox News poll indicates former professional and college football star running back Herschel Walker at 66% support, with his Republican rivals for the nomination all in the single digits.

WHAT A NEW FOX NEWS POLL SHOWS IN GEORGIA'S GOP CLASH FOR GOVERNOR
But the former corporate chief executive officer trails Kemp in fundraising and in the latest polling in their epic GOP gubernatorial primary battle in a one-time solidly red state that's become a top general election battleground.

GEORGIA GOP GUBERNATORIAL CLASH: KEMP USES TRUMP'S PAST WORDS TO TARGET PERDUE
The consultant argued that Perdue's "trying to ride the coattails of Trump and I think those coattails are getting shorter by the day here in Georgia," and predicted that "Perdue has an uphill climb to break 43%-44%."

Walker, who won a Heisman Trophy and helped propel the University of Georgia to a national championship four decades ago, was encouraged by Trump for months last year to run in the race to challenge Democratic freshman Sen. Raphael Warnock.

And the consultant argued that Walker's commanding position in the polls "is independent of Trump's endorsement" and noted that "if you watch what Herschel says and puts out on social media, he doesn't talk about Trump a whole lot."
A Fox News poll of GOP primary voters in Georgia that was released on Tuesday indicates 50% support for Kemp, with Perdue at 39% and one in ten unsure or backing another candidate in the race.
Brian Kemp's in the news every day with something conservative and strong," and pointed out that "anytime you're a governor, you have a huge home-court advantage when you run for reelection.
Trump, who had unsuccessfully urged the governor and other top Republican officials in the state to overturn the results, has repeatedly vowed to return to Georgia to campaign against Kemp.
The strategist suggested that "Trump has spread himself thin" and that the multiple endorsements can be confusing to "the average Republican voter, even the one who loves Donald Trump."
But Kemp earned Trump's ire starting in late 2020, after he certified now President Biden's narrow victory in Georgia in the presidential election, following two recounts of the vote.
Former Republican Sen. David Perdue made it official on Wednesday, trekking to Georgia's state capitol building to formally file to qualify for this year's ballot.
Trump for months urged Perdue to primary challenge the governor, and late last year he endorsed Perdue a day after the former senator launched his bid.
Another longtime Republican strategist in Georgia  who also asked to remain anonymous  said that "Kemp has done a pretty good job governing the state.
The Fox News poll, which was conducted March 2-6, follows other recent surveys that suggested Kemp holding an upper single digit lead over Perdue.
And Perdue told Fox News Digital during a recent interview that the former president would also be coming to Georgia ahead of the May 24 primary.
Fox News confirmed that Perdue will join Trump at the former president's Mar-a-Lago resort in Palm Beach, Florida, on March 16 for a fundraiser.
According to the Fox News poll, Perdue leads Kemp 52%-39% among the subgroup of GOP primary voters with a strongly favorable opinion of Trump.
Donald Trump Jr, the former president's eldest child, teamed up with Perdue on the campaign trail on Monday with stops in Cumming and Tifton.
The Fox News survey indicated Trump with a 79% favorability rating among Peach State Republicans, with the governor at 68% and Perdue at 66%.
The GOP strategist told Fox News that "the Trump endorsement helps but Herschel Walker is a legend here in Georgia, and he's very likable.
He has my complete and total endorsement," Trump says to camera in Perdue campaign TV ads that have been running statewide for six weeks.
But political insiders don't attribute Walker's large lead in the Fox News poll and other recent surveys solely to Trump's endorsement.
Asked about the Fox News poll on Wednesday morning, Perdue told reporters "we're right where we want to be right now.
But Kemp holds a large 70%-15% lead over Perdue among the small percentage of GOP voters who view Trump unfavorably.
Four years ago, with the support of Trump, Kemp narrowly defeated Democrat Stacey Abrams to win the governorship.
Despite Trump's repeated jabs at Kemp, most polling indicates he remains popular with GOP voters in Georgia.
And Walker was endorsed by the former president soon after jumping into the race in the late summer.
Perdue enjoys the backing of former President Donald Trump as he challenges conservative Gov.
Perdue's endorsement is one of five that Trump's made in various races this year in Georgia.
"Brian Kemp is really well liked by the conservative base despite what Donald Trump says."
There's a reason why sitting governors historically don't get beat in primaries."
While he might be naive politically, I think that's helping him in this regard."
The strategist also noted that "we're in the middle of the legislative session.
I'm the guy that in 2014, even in 2020, a lot of these polls missed us."
Fox News Dana Blanton and Victoria Balara contributed to this report
And he emphasized that his campaing is "doing what we need to do."
The reality is he's been a good, conservative, governor."
I want this governor to answer a lot of questions.
And Perdue is showing off that endorsement.
